Section 5 of Wong's whitepaper (current)
Use the exploits https://github.com/hotelzululima/socat_backdoor/blob/master/PoC.sage 

c = 3^flag

Socat, NOBUS
n is prime factorizable using pollard rho
p-1 is 65011-smooth, q-1 is 130927-smooth

p-1 = 2 × 5381 × 7949 × 32983 × 33641 × 34031 × 34499 × 35999 × 36037 × 36131 × 36479 × 37223 × 37951 × 38273 × 38993 × 39133 × 39709 × 39953 × 40637 × 40819 × 40927 × 41999 × 42569 × 42787 × 43711 × 43801 × 45247 × 45737 × 45833 × 46141 × 47093 × 48163 × 48673 × 49727 × 49937 × 51217 × 51229 × 51473 × 51679 × 52121 × 52667 × 53147 × 54469 × 54539 × 56659 × 56681 × 58367 × 59167 × 59333 × 59617 × 59771 × 60611 × 60859 × 61001 × 61781 × 61843 × 62129 × 62273 × 62347 × 62683 × 63127 × 63149 × 63277 × 64187 × 64373 × 64969 × 65011
q-1 = 2 × 19739 × 21419 × 68219 × 69737 × 70351 × 73477 × 75083 × 76753 × 77569 × 77969 × 78509 × 78853 × 79829 × 80369 × 82339 × 84221 × 84377 × 88001 × 89227 × 89669 × 90659 × 91541 × 92551 × 92987 × 93047 × 93739 × 93911 × 94291 × 95443 × 96851 × 98081 × 98573 × 99469 × 100313 × 100483 × 100673 × 100907 × 105263 × 105437 × 105883 × 106121 × 106163 × 106867 × 108677 × 109199 × 110321 × 110753 × 111211 × 111659 × 112327 × 112657 × 113417 × 114371 × 114487 × 115057 × 117191 × 117563 × 121883 × 123479 × 128099 × 129749 × 130927

gcd(p-1, q-1) = 2
B = 130927

The order of the group is 
phi(n) = 
phi(n) = 2^2 × 11 × 5381 × 7949 × 19739 × 21419 × 23447 × 32983 × 33641 × 34031 × 34499 × 35999 × 36037 × 36131 × 36479 × 37223 × 37951 × 38273 × 38993 × 39133 × 39709 × 39953 × 40637 × 40819 × 40927 × 41999 × 42569 × 42787 × 43711 × 43801 × 45247 × 45737 × 45833 × 46141 × 47093 × 48163 × 48673 × 49727 × 49937 × 51217 × 51229 × 51473 × 51679 × 52121 × 52667 × 53147 × 54469 × 54539 × 56659 × 56681 × 58367 × 59167 × 59333 × 59617 × 59771 × 60611 × 60859 × 61001 × 61781 × 61843 × 62129 × 62273 × 62347 × 62683 × 63127 × 63149 × 63277 × 64187 × 64373 × 64969 × 65011 × 68219 × 69737 × 70351 × 73477 × 75083 × 76753 × 77569 × 77969 × 78509 × 78853 × 79829 × 80369 × 82339 × 84221 × 84377 × 88001 × 89227 × 89669 × 90659 × 91541 × 92551 × 92987 × 93047 × 93739 × 93911 × 94291 × 95443 × 96851 × 98081 × 98573 × 99469 × 100313 × 100483 × 100673 × 100907 × 105263 × 105437 × 105883 × 106121 × 106163 × 106867 × 108677 × 109199 × 110321 × 110753 × 111211 × 111659 × 112327 × 112657 × 113417 × 114371 × 114487 × 115057 × 117191 × 117563 × 121883 × 123479 × 128099 × 129749 × 130927 × 515813 × 751670 918293 133721 176566 524233 361926 702888 006029 809035 209772 995725 362245 266044 340394 078203 096125 430206 025639 620356 587707 426449 353122 302225 990603 168325 222911 601363 887761 741413 432925 548111 075324 816208 422672 281767 120165 513504 957750 523721 166868 541212 635744 745640 062390 802622 967645 004960 366252 074671 370180 529151 943927 452730 695282 051830 687019 451327 153304 423567 048157 861416 174280 511855 724744 326219 949735 911367 562113 274238 160543 107484 386919 274056 482238 392513 503429 851598 234262 747517 241158 931317 852511 231439 406355 713405 111091 031002 596285 250179 763112 986365 329417 065169 693799 909226 191898 783616 955938 092157 096832 120881

Because of this, anyone with the knowledge of the phi's factorization and the ability to compute the discrete logarithm in subgroups of order B = 130927 module n to do so using Pohlig-Hellman

We can reduce our public key c modulo p and q, and proceed with Pohlig-Hellman
c % p = 
c % q = 


Pollard rho

1. prime factorization of order of the group
phi(n) = 2^2 × 11 × 5381 × 7949 × 19739 × 21419 × 23447 × 32983 × 33641 × 34031 × 34499 × 35999 × 36037 × 36131 × 36479 × 37223 × 37951 × 38273 × 38993 × 39133 × 39709 × 39953 × 40637 × 40819 × 40927 × 41999 × 42569 × 42787 × 43711 × 43801 × 45247 × 45737 × 45833 × 46141 × 47093 × 48163 × 48673 × 49727 × 49937 × 51217 × 51229 × 51473 × 51679 × 52121 × 52667 × 53147 × 54469 × 54539 × 56659 × 56681 × 58367 × 59167 × 59333 × 59617 × 59771 × 60611 × 60859 × 61001 × 61781 × 61843 × 62129 × 62273 × 62347 × 62683 × 63127 × 63149 × 63277 × 64187 × 64373 × 64969 × 65011 × 68219 × 69737 × 70351 × 73477 × 75083 × 76753 × 77569 × 77969 × 78509 × 78853 × 79829 × 80369 × 82339 × 84221 × 84377 × 88001 × 89227 × 89669 × 90659 × 91541 × 92551 × 92987 × 93047 × 93739 × 93911 × 94291 × 95443 × 96851 × 98081 × 98573 × 99469 × 100313 × 100483 × 100673 × 100907 × 105263 × 105437 × 105883 × 106121 × 106163 × 106867 × 108677 × 109199 × 110321 × 110753 × 111211 × 111659 × 112327 × 112657 × 113417 × 114371 × 114487 × 115057 × 117191 × 117563 × 121883 × 123479 × 128099 × 129749 × 130927 × 515813 × 751670 918293 133721 176566 524233 361926 702888 006029 809035 209772 995725 362245 266044 340394 078203 096125 430206 025639 620356 587707 426449 353122 302225 990603 168325 222911 601363 887761 741413 432925 548111 075324 816208 422672 281767 120165 513504 957750 523721 166868 541212 635744 745640 062390 802622 967645 004960 366252 074671 370180 529151 943927 452730 695282 051830 687019 451327 153304 423567 048157 861416 174280 511855 724744 326219 949735 911367 562113 274238 160543 107484 386919 274056 482238 392513 503429 851598 234262 747517 241158 931317 852511 231439 406355 713405 111091 031002 596285 250179 763112 986365 329417 065169 693799 909226 191898 783616 955938 092157 096832 120881

2. Determine value of flag % p_i ^ k_i for each i
